Action: Bulk Edit General
Go to the admin journals and articles search page at /admin/admin_site_search
Expected Test Results: * On the top right, the "Bulk Edit Records" box is visible, and "Submit" is disabled

Action: From the "Select action" pull-down choose "Withdraw from DOAJ"
Expected Test Results: * Warning under the Submit button is displayed: "You need to select "Journal" from the "Journals vs. Articles facet" to use this option"

Action: From the "Select action" pull-down choose "Reinstate into DOAJ"
Expected Test Results: * Warning under the Submit button is displayed: "You need to select "Journal" from the "Journals vs. Articles facet" to use this option"

Action: From the "Select action" pull-down choose "Journal: edit metadata..."
Expected Test Results: * Additional options unfold under Bulk Edit Records pull down but Submit button is disabled and two warnings appear: "You need to select "Journal" from the "Journals vs. Articles facet" to use this option" is displayed under the Submit button; and a Note: 'Note that bulk editing journals via this form behaves as if you have used the individual Journal edit form for each selected record and selected the "Allow incomplete form" checkbox. You will NOT receive validation errors for records which are missing required fields'

Action: From the "Select action" pull-down choose "Journal: Assign to editor group..."
Expected Test Results:
* "Enter new editor group" pull down unfold below but submit button is disabled and warning "You need to select "Journal" from the "Journals vs. Articles facet" to use this option" is displayed under the Submit button
* Click in the sub-pulldown and you are asked to type 1 or more character

Action: From the "Select action" pull-down choose "Journal: Add a note..."
Expected Test Results: * "Type note here..." text field show up below but submit button is disabled and warning "You need to select "Journal" from the "Journals vs. Articles facet" to use this option" is displayed under the button

Action: Withdraw from DOAJ
Go to the admin applications search page at /admin/admin_site_search
Restrict search journals to smaller number (eg. choose only "Subject" -> "Technology" and "Country"-> "Spain")
From the "Journals vs. Articles" assets on the left choose Journals and from "in DOAJ?" choose "True" (note how many journals are not in DOAJ for future reference)
Expected Test Results: * Correct restricted search results appear, note the summary number of journals found  for future reference

Action: From Bulk Edit Records "Select action..." pull down choose "withdraw from DOAJ" and click "Submit" button
Expected Test Results:
* Pop up appears: "This operation will affect #nr journals" (#nr is number of journals, the same as number of journals in search result from 2.3.1)
* Options "Cancel" and "OK" is available

Action: Click "Cancel" on pop up
Expected Test Results: * The operation is cancelled

Action: Click "Submit" button again
Click "OK" on the pop-up
Expected Test Results:
* Message banner appears on the top of the page that includes:
* Numer of journals queued for edit
* Link to the background job interface
* A link to dismiss the message

Action: Click on the link provided to see the background job that was created
Expected Test Results: * The set_in_doaj background job is created

Action: Click "More Information"
Expected Test Results: * set_in_doaj__journal_ids parameter contains correct number of journals' ids and set_in_doaj__in_doaj -- true parameter is set

Action: Close the background jobs window
Click dismiss on the message banner
Expected Test Results: * Banner disappears

Restrict search journals to smaller number (eg. choose only "Subject" -> "Technology" and "Country"-> "Spain")

Action: From Bulk Edit Records "Select action..." pull down choose "withdraw from DOAJ" and click "Submit" button

Action: Click "Submit" button again
Click "OK" on the pop-up

Action: Click on the link provided to see the background job that was created

Action: Close the background jobs window
Click dismiss on the message banner

Click "Submit" button

Action: Click "Submit" button again

Expected Test Results: * The set_in_doaj background job is created

Action: Click "More Information"

Action: Journal: Assign to editor group
Go to the admin applications search page at /admin/admin_site_search
Restrict search journals to smaller number (eg. choose only "Subject" -> "Technology" and "Country"-> "Spain")
From the "Journals vs. Articles" assets on the left choose Journals
Expected Test Results: * Correct restricted search results appear, note the summary number of journals found for future reference

Action: From Bulk Edit Records "Select action..." pull down choose "Journal: assign to editor group ..."
Expected Test Results: * "Enter new editor group" pull down appears below

Action: Choose editor group
Click "Submit" button
Expected Test Results:
* Pop up appears: "This operation will affect #nr journals" (#nr is number of journals, the same as number of journals in search result from 2.3.1)
* Options "Cancel" and "OK" is available

Action: Click "Cancel" on pop up
Expected Test Results: * The operation is cancelled

Action: Click "Submit" button again
Click "OK" on the pop-up
Expected Test Results:
* Message banner appears on the top of the page that includes:
* Numer of journals queued for edit
* Link to the background job interface

Action: Click on the link provided to see the background job that was created
Expected Test Results: * The journal_bulk_edit background job is created

Action: Click "More Information"
Expected Test Results: * set_in_doaj__journal_ids parameter contains correct number of journals' ids and journal_bulk_edit__replacement_metadata -- {"editor_group": "<name>"} parameter is set - where <name> is the name of editors group you've chosen

Action: Close the background jobs window
Click dismiss on the message banner
Expected Test Results: * Banner disappears

Action: Journal: Add a note
Go to the admin applications search page at /admin/admin_site_search
Restrict search journals to smaller number (eg. choose only "Subject" -> "Technology" and "Country"-> "Spain")
From the "Journals vs. Articles" assets on the left choose Journals
Expected Test Results: * Correct restricted search results appear, note the summary number of journals found for future reference

Action: From Bulk Edit Records "Select action..." pull down choose "Journal: Add a note ..."
Expected Test Results: * "Type note here..." text area appears below the pull-down

Action: Add any note to the "Type note here... " text area
Click "Submit" button
Expected Test Results:
* Pop up appears: "This operation will affect #nr journals" (#nr is number of journals, the same as number of journals in search result from 2.3.1)
* Options "Cancel" and "OK" is available

Action: Click "Cancel" on pop up
Expected Test Results: * The operation is cancelled

Action: Repeat step 2.4
Click "OK"
Expected Test Results:
* Message banner appears on the top of the page that includes:
* Numer of journals queued for edit
* Link to the background job interface

Action: Click on the link provided to see the background job that was created
Expected Test Results: * The journal_bulk_edit background job is created

Action: Click "More Information"
Expected Test Results: * set_in_doaj__journal_ids parameter contains correct number of journals' ids and journal_bulk_edit__note parameter is set to your note

Action: Close the background jobs window
Click dismiss on the message banner
Expected Test Results: * Banner disappears

Action: Journal: Delete records
Go to the admin applications search page at /admin/admin_site_search
Choose Delete records
Expected Test Results: * An message appears saying: You need to select an option in the "Journals vs. Articles facet" to use this option

Action: Select Journals from the facet
Expected Test Results: * The message disappears

Action: Restrict search journals to smaller number (eg. choose only "Subject" -> "Technology" and "Country"-> "Spain")
From the "Journals vs. Articles" assets on the left choose Journals
Choose the ISSN of one journal and enter it as a search term
Expected Test Results: * You should have only one journal as your search result

Action: From Bulk Edit Records "Select action..." pull down choose "Delete records ..."
Click Submit
Expected Test Results: * Warning message appears asking if you sure and shows you OK and Cancel button

Action: Click Cancel
Expected Test Results: * Message disappears

Action: Click Submit and click OK
Expected Test Results: * Warning message appears showing the number of journals and articles affected

Action: Click OK
Expected Test Results:
* Message appears showing number of journals and articles queued for edit.
* A link to the background job is available
* Link to dismiss

Action: Click on the link provided to see the background job that was created
Expected Test Results: * The journal_bulk_delete background job is created

Action: Click "More Information"
Expected Test Results: * journal_bulk_delete shows the the correct number of journal IDs you deleted. (Should be one if you followed the steps above). selection_query shows the ISSN of the journal.

Action: Close the background jobs window
Click dismiss on the message banner
Expected Test Results: * Banner disappears
